headline: Pasta Salad with Homemade Dressing
description: A homemade Italian pasta salad dressing takes this simple pasta salad loaded with veggies, cheese, pepperoni, and olives to a whole new level! Perfect for weekday lunches or picnics.

video.description: A homemade Italian pasta salad dressing takes this simple pasta salad loaded with veggies, cheese, pepperoni, and olives to a whole new level! Serve it right away or make it ahead for packed lunches, picnics, or summer barbecues.
video.name: How to Make Pasta Salad with Homemade Dressing

name: Pasta Salad with Homemade Dressing
recipeIngredient: 1 (8 ounce) package uncooked tri-color rotini pasta
1 medium red onion, very thinly sliced and cut into 1-inch pieces
1 (6 ounce) can pitted black olives, drained

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add rotini and cook until tender yet firm to the bite, 8 to 10 minutes. Drain, rinse with cold water, and drain again.
Transfer drained, cooked pasta to a large bowl. Add pepperoni, provolone cheese, red onion, cucumber, bell peppers, olives, parsley, and Parmesan cheese.
Mix olive oil, vinegar, garlic, basil, oregano, ground mustard, salt, and pepper for dressing in a jar with a lid. Seal the jar, and shake until well combined.
Pour dressing over the pasta salad; toss until well coated. Serve immediately, or cover and chill in the refrigerator for up to 8 hours before serving.

review.reviewBody: it's good
I can't have cucumber so I used celery. So everything else Excellent!!!!⁰
It was good although I added some sugar to dressing
Loved the dressing recipe! I just put a little spicy brown mustard in it and used a blender
O-M-G!!! SOOO tasty! I added fresh spinach, feta & shredded carrots. Substituted onion & garlic powder (I'm bound by picky eaters). Omitted salt (bc feta is salty). I can't wait to serve it tonight!

Delicious! I had to make a few changes based on what I had. 3oz turkey pepperoni, 3oz light salami, mozzarella string cheese, dried parsley, and cut the vinegar(husband doesn't like too much). It turned out great.
I added mushrooms. And it was wonderful!
Have made twice. I really like the dressing . My family thinks it’s pretty good.
It tastes amazing, made it prolly four times for my favorite birthday

I used this recipe as a general guideline and made some alterations to make it gluten free. The cheese used was altered as well to be dairy free. I have to say it looks pretty similar. I also used a store bought greek salad marinade. Added mini pepperonis and threw in some carrots for a pop of color and flavor. Instead of olives we used halved grape tomatoes. DELICIOUS!

Definitely needs more of the dressing once you let it sit (absorbs it all). And I left out the pepperoni to make it a bit healthier. And I substituted red bell peppers for the green. I'd definitely make it again.

I loved the dressing. I basically have to follow the ‘likes’ within the family so I make my own salad mixture but wanted a homemade dressing and this one hit the spot. I will use again for sure! Thank you!
Absolutely delicious. I doubled the dressing. Everyone LOVED it!!
Great, simple pasta salad.
Everyone keeps asking me to make this salad when I ask what should I bring...
Everyone keeps asking me to make this salad when I ask what should I bring...
None of my family enjoyed this.

Made this yesterday. It is very good but not enough dressing. Today I am making more dressing and will add it to bowl. The ingredients I had on hand were a little bit different--mozzarella, genoa salami, no parmesan Murray's olives, apple cider vinegar
I added cherry tomatoes, used pepper jack cheese and added just a little sweeter (trivia). Yummy
Loved it! Dressing was amazing! I made extra because it was so good
Double the dressing!
very very good
I made this as is, and it turned out perfect! The sit time with the dressing on the pasta was vital to soaking up all of the vinegar flavor. It was a huge hit at the potluck party!
Made for a party and it was a hit. I wanted a side dish no meats and it was delish. I also added raw veggies that were in my frig.

Great family fav. I’ve made it a few times. Def double the dressing. Always. Ive also swapped out the pepperoni and provolone and used ham steak and cheddar and left out the Parm. Worked great. Everyone loved it. Excellent recipe.

This was an amazing and light pasta salad. The dressing is to die for it is so good!! The only change I made was I didn't use cucumbers and added garbanzo beans. I also doubled the dressing to have some of needed later. I will definitely be making this again!!
So good with homemade dressing! I don't like cucumbers so left those out. I added green salad olives for one half olives.
I thought it was delicious. I mostly followed the recipe. YUM!
I doubled the dressing and it was wonderful.
Kudos!

I didn’t have all the veggies; just had green pepper, onion and garlic. Used sliced pepperoni (cut in half) and cheddar cheese.
But the dressing was good (the parm cheese definitely completes the flavor!)
I would absolutely make this again!
I made the recipe as stated except for adding grape tomatoes halved and some shredded carrot and it was amazing - best ever! No problem with it being too dry - loved the dressing.
I serve the meat and cheese on the side so this dish is vegan and vegetarian if needed. I also replace the green peppers with other, ripe, colors.

Gotta confess that I was just after the dressing part of this. After all, I know I am not the only one who usually just looks for pasta salad recipes for ideas and to make sure I am not forgetting some cool ingredient. 
Anyway, I was never a big fan of pasta salads until a year ago when I got one as a side at Coco's Italian Restaurant in Nashville. Their pasta side salad was so exquisitely delicious that I had to figure out what was going on. It was obvious that it had NOT been marinaded in the dressing as is the usual habit, but just what kind of dressing WAS it? The waiter assured me that it was their own recipe of sun-dried tomato vinaigrette and that I could purchase some at the deli counter of the attached store. Did I neglect to mention that the attached store is replete with interesting Italian kitsch and ingredients? And that they do multiple tours of Italy every year in search of more cool stuff? Yes, you can go along, too. Needless to say, I brought home some of the dressing and then tried several commercial varieties when that ran out, since it is an 8-hour drive to Nashville. So for Thanksgiving this year we were cooking home-made everything (with help from AllRecipes.com of course!) and I went in search of a dressing recipe. This one sounded promising, despite a glaring absence of dried tomatoes, so I ran off to Eurofresh and grabbed some dried tomatoes and fresh basil leaves and minced them up. I made the dressing a day before Thanksgiving so it could blend a
Good basic dressing I use on pasta salad with tuna and whatever vegetables I have. Better than bottled. Simple enough thatingredients are in most pantries.

This was good. I docked it a star because the red wine vinegar was a bit more pungent than I like.
I also made the mistake (my mistake) of using shredded rather than grated cheese. The cheese never blended in because the shreds were too large.
Very good. Will make again
Agree with doubling the dressing and add more vegetables. Will take to more gatherings to "wow" people with. It goes fast!

This is so delicious! Absolutely the best pasta salad I’ve ever eaten! I didn’t have fresh parsley, so I used half the amount of dried. I omitted the black olives because I’m the only one who likes them. I followed another reviewer’s advice and quartered sliced pepperoni and used slices of provolone that I cut into strips. I took it to a 4th of July picnic today and I got so many compliments. Usually pasta salad tastes sour because of the Italian dressing, but not this. This homemade dressing is so good. You could add any ingredients you want to this salad and it would be delicious as long as you use this dressing recipe.
Added some barely-steamed broccoli florets

I made this recipe exactly as printed. It was the most bland, tasteless recipe I've ever made - it was like it needed some dressing - so I poured on my old standby Italian drsg which was tasteful. So disappointed in this recipe!
This is by far the best pasta salad I have ever tasted. A definite make again must.

I made this exactly as stated and loved it! It was a HUGE hit at my daughter's graduation party. I've shared the recipe with several people who asked for it. I thought the creamy pasta salad that I also made would be more popular, but I was wrong.

This is the best pasta salad ever! I took it to a Girl Scout camp out and everyone asked for the recipe. I doubled the dressing and used a little less olive oil. I didn’t have any mustard seed so I omitted that and I only had mozzarella string cheese, which actually made it easier to dice

This recipe is flexible! I made sure I had all of the fresh produce on hand... didn't make certain I had some of the staples. When I made the dressing, I didn't have red wine vinegar or ground mustard - two items I typically have! I used a raspberry balsamic vinegar instead of the red wine. Left out the mustard and added a package of ranch dressing. I'm not a ranch addict but so many people are. It was a hit - I even got a text a few days later requesting the recipe... I sent the original and my variation. I never look at a recipe as 'the only way to make it.' My favorite recipes are solid to start and can be varied as desired (or needed!).

3.26.18 First, this absolutely needs to chill in the fridge for the flavors to develop; I left mine in the refrigerator overnight. If your review is based on how it tastes right after you’ve mixed it up, you’ll be disappointed. I find pasta salad a good side kick to so many things, have made quite a few recipes, and I will say that I particularly liked the addition of the pepperoni. As with many pasta salad dressings, this was has a red wine vinaigrette, but I think it was calling out for more tang, maybe to complement that pepperoni, not sure? It was good, we liked it, but I wouldn’t say it was my favorite, and there’s a lot more prep time chopping and cubing than with many other recipes.
Tried this because of the homemade dressing, and it was AMAZING! I opt for more veggies and no cheese or meats in mine, but the dressing is great for whatever you decide to put on yours yumyumyum!!
Very tasty! I omitted ground mustard seed since I didn’t have any and added tomatoes.

This is the closest recipe to the PASTA SALAD that we always made when I was a child. I use Cucumber, pepperoni, bell peppers, cherry tomatoes, pepper jack cheese and Colby jack cheese and if I have a lot of people to feed I'll add in some chicken. Family FAVORITE

I was disappointed in this recipe. For the cost and effort, it just wasn't good. It almost didn't have taste... 2 stars because my husband said it was alright, but I couldn't tell if he was just trying to be nice or not... made a huge bowl of pasta that my family of 4 barely ate :(
I just added what I had on hand. Broccoli, artichoke hearts, tomatoes, chick peas. The dressing was delicious!
Love the addition of pepperoni! I also added kidney beans to make it a solo meal. Thanks!

Best Salad ever!!! It was cumbersome to cut everything but once it was done and prepared I did not want to stop! Even my bf who doesnt like salads was going back for more. Thank you so much! I wouldnt change a thing
This is very tasty. I also found this recipe just for the dressing. I used many of the same ingredients in this recipe however I did not put any meat in the pasta salad. I will make it again.
I am obsessed with this dressing and will use it for all sorts of salads!!

I tried writing a review and mistakenly hit "done". As I was saying I eliminated the cheese and meat because my daughter is a vegan. I substituted with blanched broccoli and raw chopped baby carrots. For the dressing, I didn't have fresh garlic so I substituted with garlic powder and used a dash of cayenne pepper and agave nectar to give a sweet tang because the vinegar was a bit overwhelming. I used Gluten-Free brown rice rotini pasta. I also love using adobo and ground white pepper. It turned out delicious.

This is a KEEPER! It's great because you can use whatever veggies you have in the fridge. I used pepperoncini, roasted red peppers, sliced mini-peppers, sliced red onion, no olives or provalone mainly because I didn't have them. Also didn't have pepperoni, but will include next time. The dressing is terrific, I agree. I only used 1/2 the dressing to lighten it up. Only problem is not eating all the leftovers tomorrow when no one is looking...

I use this recipe for the dressing, as I prefer home made ones over bottled. I don't really ever have mustard seeds in the house, so I put a scant teaspoon of Dijon in. For the rest, I use whatever shape pasta I fancy and whatever veg is on hand. Always keep in the parmesan cheese! It makes it lovely! I sometime go meatless, and it is yummy as well.

I Love this recipe!! I really pump it up by adding more veggies (sweet corn, edamame, chopped purple kale, all 4 colors of peppers, artichoke hearts, etc cuz possibilities are endless!) I omit the pepperoni to keep it vegetarian. I use cubed vegetable jack cheese & I add ground flax seeds to it. Thank you so much for this delish dish!!
Simple and delicious! Love it!!

Very simple, great tasting recipe. I didnt have mustard seed so I used mustard powder, but everything else I had on hand which is always a huge plus. I took other reviewers suggestions and doubled the dressing for 1 box/lb macaroni. This recipe will be the starter for my future pasta salads.

This is very good. I used sliced pepperoni cut in half and 3oz was plenty. I used generous teaspoon of dried parsley instead of fresh. About 1/2 teaspoon of dry mustard instead of ground mustard seed. Followed the suggestion of other raters and saved a little of the dressing to moisten the pasta right before serving. It did take me one and a half CSI reruns to prepare though, a lot of chopping involved.
This has no flavor at all. Will not make again.
Dressing is the best!

Lots of prep is the only bad thing about this recipe. Would love to know how BonnieS did it in 30 minutes. This salad is colorful and delicious. I could eat it everyday. I followed almost exactly. I cut my cucs and olives in half, used parsley flakes and only used about 1/2-3/4 of the red onion and chopped it because red onion is strong and I didn't want it to overpower the salad. As someone else wrote, make a double batch of the dressing. Pour half over before chilling and save the other for after as it dries up a little in the frig and you will need more. I may use a different cheese next time, something with more flavor, otherwise, this is my new dish to bring to outings.

This was a great pasta salad. I made it for a large family crowd and it got eaten up. You can add any vegetable you like and leave out what you don't like.. It is the homemade salad dressing that makes us so special.
Very Good! You can add different vegies or take away some. I used zesty Italian dressing instead.
Love it !! I used Cheddar cheese instead. I also added a little bit of Italian dressing because it got a little dry when all put together .... great recipe will make again for sure.
I didn't add the cucumber or black olives. I used American cheese and otherwise left it unchanged. This is quite possibly the best pasta salad we've ever had!

This is almost identical to a pasta salad I've been making for years, but usually for parties. It's easy and quick enough to make more often...and delicious! I never added pepperoni as it overpowers the other flavors (I think), but rather, cubed ham. I also find that red wine vinegar doesn't add enough flavor to justify the weird color. A pre-made, balsamic dressing is fine. I also leave out the parsley (don't like the bitterness) and use fresh or dried basil. I like Rebecca's idea of adding crabmeat or tuna--nice and light!
I love this dish. I make it a lot and just love the sauce that goes with it. Even if I don't have sausage I use mushrooms instead. You will love this dish vegetarian or not.

I looked this up for a pasta salad without a mayo base and one that wasn't Greek. I picked this one specifically because it had homemade dressing -yummy! I'd bet it's great as written and I will do it that way in the wintertime, but since I had fresh basil, I used that instead of the parsley, oregano, and dried basil as another reviewer suggested. I also chopped the red onion and included it in the dressing jar to let it "pickle" before mixing with the salad - I don't like raw onions much. I'm sure you could use any veggies you wanted to -I used 1/2 red pepper, 1/2 green pepper, and small crown of broccoli. I didn't have provolone and didn't want to add pepperoni so I used caraway cheddar we had on hand - fantastic!!!!
I used bow tie pasta, and added a couple extra veggies. Dressing was wonderful. Even better the next day.

I liked this recipe because the dressing is done from scratch! Though I omitted the olive oil provolone cheese, olives, and sausage... And replaced the green pepper with red and yellow. It turned out beautifully!!! Also, I made and ate it within an hour... I'm sure the flavours will be even better tomorrow.

Wow! Best pasta salad ever! I made this yesterday using a 12 ounce box of 3-color rotini, so I increased the cheese & pepperoni to 8 ounces each. The dressing I increased all by about 50%. This was the best pasta salad I've ever eaten, by far. Hearty, rustic, super flavorful and really colorful! I served it about 4 hours after making it, it was great! Today it's even better! And here's the bonus...today I made another batch of the dressing (with chopped parsley) as a marinade for pork chops....they were awesome! So yeah, thanks for this recipe, I'm a fan!

This was a huge hit. I made this with some changes. I used feta cheese instead of provolone since provolone is rare where I live and didn't add olives. I also substituted rosemary for mustard seed. It came out great though. The olive out balances out the feta and parm cheeses and you get a creamy cheese flavor.

I had to take the cheese out due to a food allergy. Used green, yellow and red bell peppers (was making a double batch). Will add some grape tomatoes before serving. The homemade dressing is fantastic!!
Lovely recipe and I would make it again but with a little less red vinegar.
I made this for a party. Everyone loved it!
This is really good! I did double the dressing and made the day before, added half at first and a bit more when I served it. Everybody love it!

A really good cold salad meal for hot summer days. I substituted green onion for the red. The dressing is really simple, includes ingredients most people have on hand, and is what makes the salad.

Next time, I may use different meat and cheese; maybe add some tomatoes just before serving (or use sundried) or try artichoke hearts instead of black olives. Lots of room for "play" in the ingredients.
Pretty good

Best pasta salad ever! The only changes I made were using salami and mozzarella cheese. The dressing is what makes this salad. I did take advice from other reviewers and I doubled the dressing. I used half when I made it and the other half the next day to refresh it; otherwise it might have been a little too dry.

What do you do with leftover veggies from a vegetable platter? Make Pasta salad of course! Veggies were already prepped so all I had to do was slice them up, added grape tomatoes, substituted mozzarella for the provolone & totally forgot the parsley, oops. Like many others I really only came here for the dressing recipe but since these were the ingredients I had on hand anyway this is what I made, using cavatapi instead of rotini. I always add another batch of dressing before serving pasta salad since I don't like it too dry & this dressing was simple to make.

This is very versatile. I made extra dressing for the comments of others. I also made my salad with less noodles and lots of vegetables. I added some Broccoli and baby kale. This was very delicious and I used my leftover dressing on something else later too.

I mostly used this recipe for the delicious dressing. I made my pasta salad with a pound of chopped rotisserie chicken, a cup of grated Parmesan, cucumber, diced sweet mini peppers, artichoke hearts, olives, chickpeas, and bow tie pasta. It was absolutely delicious and my whole family loved it. I'd definitely make it again!
Very tasty dressing. I substituted crumbled bacon for the sausage and added spinach leaves radishes and cauliflower. Delicious

I have made this 3 times using different meats each time. I used the pepperoni, cubed ham & grilled sausage links. I think I like the sausage the best. Everyone that has eaten this salad rave about it. Love this!!!
I've made this recipe several times and it's always delicious.
It was delicious, couple changes were I used marble cheese, and next time I would use more seasoning. I made a lot but it didn't last long in my house as my husband loved it!
good dressing
Best pasta salad I've ever had. Dressing is superb.
This is amazing .... Love the dressing
This was fantastic everyone raved. I doubled the dressing as per other tips. Husband is already talking about eating the leftovers!
This dressing was perfect! My salad had salami and feta instead of provolone and pepperoni. I also threw in some fresh basil and real Kalamata olives. Canned olives are a no-no in this house.
Followed recipe completely. Could use more dressing but it's delicious.
Oh my goodness. That's what my taste buds said when I made this dish today for my husband. Delicious.

Best pasta salad I've ever made! I used the hint by another reviewer to save a little of the dressing to toss on just before serving. Also, I did not have a cucumber, so used what I had which was a small zucchini sliced and cut into quarters, tasted great!
For at least 10 years, I don't think I've ever commented on a recipe before on this site, but this was the best italian dressing I've ever had. This is one to keep.
